programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: 4/5. Gloria Hunniford and Chris Bavin investigate whether we should really be giving up bacon and sausages, after new research suggested they're bad for us. Also in HD. [AD,S]
15/16. Howes Family: In 2013, Dave Howes was hoping a trial week in Australia would persuade wife Laurra to move their family there for good. Have they moved two years later? Also in HD. [S]
programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited

programme.desc: 9/10. Series which sees insurance fraudsters caught on camera. A fraudster goes on the run after a claim for over Â£100,000 worth of camera equipment is exposed as a fraud. Also in HD. [S]

MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: 15/21. Knockout week of the culinary competition. The chefs travel to Lord's Cricket Ground, where they cook a three-course menu for ex-England captain Mike Gatting and guests. [S,SL]

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: The BBC's daily news and current affairs programme with original stories, exclusive interviews, audience debate and breaking news. Also in HD. [S]

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, plus top interviews and analysis. Also in HD. [S]

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Andrew Neil with the latest political news, interviews and debate. Also in HD. [S]

programme.title: Coast
programme.subtitle: John Paul Jones at Whitehaven
programme.desc: Neil Oliver discovers why a delegation from the US Navy is sent over to the port of Whitehaven every year to honour the Scot John Paul Jones. [S]

programme.title: The Pallisers
programme.desc: 23/26. Based on the six political novels by Anthony Trollope. Plantagenet has paid Lopez's election expenses and Lopez takes his version of the election expenses story to Quintus Slide. [S]
8/10. Anita Rani: Anita Rani finds out what happened to her grandfather during the Partition of India. Contains some upsetting scenes. Also in HD. [AD,S]
programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: 2/10. L'Chaim, to Life: Australian period drama. On returning to Ash Park, George tells the family that he is going to make an important announcement at dinner. Also in HD. [S]

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: 15/20. Mediterranean Favourites: Recipes from some of the BBC's best-loved TV chefs. Ainsley celebrates dishes from across the Channel, including the Greedy Italians' linguine. Also in HD. [S]

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: 3/10. Plant Predators: Documentary series. David Attenborough meets the earth's most astounding herbivores, whose prey is armoured, indigestible and sometimes poisonous. [AD,S]

programme.subtitle: Stafford
programme.desc: Antiques challenge. Tim Wonnacott and the teams travel to the Staffordshire Showground to search for bargains with experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant. Also in HD. [AD,S]

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the show in which teams from all over the UK take on probably the greatest quiz team in Britain, made up of some of the country's top quiz champions. Also in HD. [S]

Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: 5/20. St Andrew's to Edinburgh: On the last leg of his journey across Scotland from west to east, Michael Portillo pays homage to the birthplace of golf at St Andrews. Also in HD. [AD,S]

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: 11/20. Presenters John Craven and Johnny Ball search Hampshire and Dorset for antiques, aided by experts Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell. [S]

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: 27/31. John Humphrys asks the questions as the hunt continues for the nation's Mastermind. Subjects in this semi-final include Men Behaving Badly and Inspector Barnaby novels. Also in HD. [S]

programme.title: Canals - The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores how the nation's canals were saved following years of postwar neglect, becoming places of tranquillity and popular for boating holidays. Also in HD. [S]
